sub_title: Customer Support Application Engineer at ASML
summary:
Enthusiastic technical specialist with customer focus.  

Experience in dealing with customers in international environments. Interested in technology industry in an international setting and personal growth. Background in technical customer support for advanced telephone exchanges, controls architecture for airport process automation and advanced lithography machines.

Specialties: - Goal oriented team player with a high level of ownership
- Analysis and understanding of customer needs and translate this to solutions
- International Customer orientation, dealing with foreign cultures
- Understanding of organizational influences from different departments

profile_positions.description:
Working in a multi-disciplinary team of data scientists and engineers to uncover causal relationships between equipment parameters and system performance. Implement (un-)supervised machine learning models on the high-dimensional features space of the most advanced microlithography machines around the globe.
- Support Analytics dashboards which generate actionable insights from Big Data at our worldwide customers
- Drive adoption of Analytics at our customers
- Customize dashboard to customer way of working
- Turn project requirements into custom-formatted Analytics dashboards. 

To achieve and report measurable results in the performance optimization of the newest lithography machines running at the customer site by:
- Relationship building between ASML and customers. 
- Inter-connecting role between customer and ASML internal departments such as marketing and development. 
- Solutions provider to customer problems. 
- Customer consultant in proactively improving the performance. 
- New product introduction expert
- Intelligence gatherer for ASML’s new product development and marketing and sales departments.
profile_positions.title: Customer Support Application Engineer

profile_positions.description:
As an ASML Start-up Engineer I provide introduction support for new ASML systems and upgrades and help ensure they are installed on-time.  
 
Main responsibilities:
· Supporting on-site introduction of new model machines and/or new platforms to our local customer service team and customer engineers 
· Managing system upgrades for new and existing ASML systems
· Mature the product by driving the cycle time and performance specifications 
· Transferring knowledge of new products or platforms to enable local engineers to sustain the new product by themselves 
· Keep up to date on the latest technologies by maintaining a network of specialists within the ASML community
· Prevent issues from re-occurring by driving a structured issue resolution process 
· Taking part in availability / reliability projects to help identify improvements in failure sensitivity and maintainability, and then ensuring that these improvements are implemented in new and existing products.
profile_positions.title: Start-up Equipment Support engineer (NPI)

profile_positions.description:
1. Technical problem solving:
• Solve complex technical problems by remote analyzing data and creating pro-active action plans.
• When not able to solve problem remote, traveling onsite to solve the problem at the customer site.
• Facilitate in escalations from other continental Global Support Centers (Asia/USA) towards Factory.
• Manage the (technical) escalation, secure that the right data is available and provide routine update to management and stakeholders.
• Identify, secure and support rollout of improvements for installed base machines.

2. Knowledge proliferation
• Identify learning by use of backend call handling and make sure that proper follow-up is secured.
• Mentor trainees and deliver feedback on potential improvements
• Proliferate knowledge to the field at every opportunity: Combine on-site support with knowledge transfers to local organization

3. New Product Introduction (NPI) preparation
• During the NPI phase be assigned to the project in order to gain the required skills and knowledge to independently support field escalations. 
• Transfer and share gained skills and knowledge within World Wide Global Support Centers in order to establish and maintain equal continental Global Support Center continental support teams.
• Onsite introduction phase support by delivering knowledge/escalation handling to local organization.
profile_positions.title: Global Support Center Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Vanderlande Industries has 2.000 employees and is dedicated to improving its customers’ business processes and competitive position by providing automated material handling systems. Focusing on distribution centers, parcel and postal sortation facilities, as well as baggage handling at airports all over the world.

Activities: 
Supply international customers with an optimized controls solution for baggage handling systems. In every project the emphasis is on close partnership with the customer, extending from initial analysis of the underlying business processes through to total life-cycle support.
•	Translate customer requirements to best practice and economical controls concepts.
•	Part of a multidisciplinary team who designs, prices and presents  the best solution to customers in the Eastern European and Nordic area.
•	New product development: Recognize business opportunities,  define requirements (from market research and customer feedback),  prepare sales material, share knowledge with multidisciplinary teams. Act as link between the customer and internal organization. Examples are: Business Process Intelligence (Analysis and reporting tool) and a Baggage Reconciliation System.  
•	Main focus on Eastern Europe and Nordic countries, worked on projects in Korea, Singapore, Argentina and Brazil with a value of 1-20 mln euro.
profile_positions.title: Controls Sales Engineer International

profile_positions.description:
Ericsson has 88.000 employees and is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment and related services to mobile and fixed network operators globally.

Activities:
Support:
•	Technical diagnosis and  problem solving for mobile telecom operators in the Benelux. Initially by remote analysis of the problem and on-site when needed. When the problem could not be solved locally within the lead time coordinate with 3 global support centers as single point of contact in the escalation.
•	Regular product and problem discussions with customer.
•	24/7 callout service.

Supply (new product introduction): 
•	Introduce, demonstrate and rollout new soft- and hardware at customer sites.
•	Discuss and assess technical customer whishes.
•	Frequent contact within the Ericsson Group during all phases of the product cycle (± 1,5 years; from verification, rollout, service to software maintenance).

International projects:
•	Verification and demonstration of new software for a  telecom operator in England (4 months).
•	Writing of test documentation (including testing and demonstration) at the Global Service Delivery Center in Finland for software which is deployed globally (3 months).
•	Local verification and demonstration of software for an English telecom operator. Completed these projects as rollout coordinator in England (2 projects of 5 months during which I transferred knowledge of  remote scripting to the team).
profile_positions.title: Technical Support engineer in the Local Customer Support Organisation
